What is an Education Services Specialist?

Education Services Specialists [ESS], usually civilians, are the subject matter experts on education for a particular branch of service. They conduct partnership initiatives at the state and local level and maintain relationships between educators, institutions and community partners and the military recruiting services. They also manage and support education and career programs sponsored by the military that are available to all students, regardless of military intent or eligibility.

The ESS has a professional background in education and works between the worlds of education and military. The ESS is able to answer a wide variety of questions that counselors might have about programs, such as the ASVAB-CEP, educational requirements for military service and educational and training opportunities for service members once they enlist. ESSs also work to stay up to date on local and state educational and school counseling trends and standards - areas where counselors are likely to have specific expertise. Not all branches have an Education Services Specialist.
